intro.headline: Four Climates, One Region
intro.tagline: Sea, Valley, Foothills, Alps â€” All Within an Hour
paragraphs: Veneto doesn't have a climate. It has four. Cortina d'Ampezzo sits at 1,224 meters in the Dolomites, where January mornings hit -8Â°C and ski season runs five months. Jesolo, two hours south, is a sun-bleached Adriatic beach town where the same January morning is a mild 9Â°C walk along the shore.

Between them: the Po Valley â€” Padua, Treviso, Vicenza â€” where fog rolls in November and doesn't fully lift until March, but summer evenings are warm, sociable, and endlessly long. And Verona, sheltered by Lake Garda's microclimate, sits a few degrees warmer than its valley neighbors year-round.
This isn't a region you experience in one note. It's a region you tune to your preference â€” altitude by altitude, season by season.
intro.hoverQuote: In Veneto, you don't check the weather. You choose your altitude.
intro.ctaText: Slide through the seasons and feel what life is actually like, month by month.
